column17: The incident occurred in the Mazza district of Damascus.
column18: 04/27/2004: Four gunmen detonated a car bomb in the diplomatic quarters of Damascus, Syria in the Mazza district. Syrian security forces then surrounded the gunmen and a gunbattle ensued. One police officer and one civilian was killed as well as two of the gunmen. The two other gunmen were wounded in the attack.
column55: Indiscriminate Syrian civilian near the Diplomatic Quarters in Damascus
column125: Government officials believe that Al-Qaida was responsible for the attack but have not officially confirmed it.

column17: The incident occurred near the settlements of Darbassiyah and Tell Abiad.
column18: 10/10/1998: Turkish officials claimed that a number of bombs exploded near the settlements of Darbassiyah and Tall al-Abayad, Syria. The attack was allegedly targeted at Syrian military facilities, but the Syrian government denied this claim. The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) was suspected for carrying out this attack.
column125: \The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) compounds were also affected by this attack
column126: but Turkish officials claimed that this was the PKK's effort to \"\"cover their tracks.\"\" Officials claimed that this attack was carried out in an effort to hide evidence that the PKK had been launching terror attacks in Turkey for Syria.\""
column127: \\"\"Syria Denies Explosions on its Territory near Turkish border"
